did.abstract: Collection consists of business and family correspondence relating to the cotton textile manufacturing and commission mercantile businesses. Businesses represented include Swift, Hamberger & Co., a cotton factory, and George P. Swift & Hamburger, Warehouse and Commission merchants in Columbus. Correspondents include Hamburger's wife, "Toodie," and his partner, George P. Swift, Sr., of Columbus, Ga. Letters describe Hamburger's efforts to establish a mill and cotton manufacturing concern, and of his 1871 trip to Europe where he arranged for insurance for the mill and visited his relatives. There are also two grade reports from Wesleyan Female College, and a photograph.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Manufacturer, of Waynmanville, Upson Co., Ga. Hamburger emigrated to the United States from Durkheim, Bavaria, prior to 1857.
